snippet: Israeli historians and opposition politicians joined Palestinians in denouncing the Israeli prime minister for saying the grand mufti of Jerusalem gave Hitler the idea of annihilating Jews.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, addressing Zionist Congress, accuses grand mufti of Jerusalem, Haj Amin al-Husseini, of giving Adolph Hitler idea of systematically exterminating European Jews; speech sparks uproar, with denunciations of Netanyahu coming from both Israeli historians and opposition politicians.
lead_paragraph: Israeli historians and opposition politicians joined Palestinians in denouncing the Israeli prime minister for saying the grand mufti of Jerusalem gave Hitler the idea of annihilating Jews.

headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Says Palestinian Inspired Holocaust, and Uproar Ensues
headline.main: Netanyahu Denounced for Saying Palestinian Inspired Holocaust
